1.text: Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ, according to [the] command of God our Saviour, and of Christ Jesus our hope,

2.text: to Timotheus, [my] true child in faith: grace, mercy, peace, from God our Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.text: Even as I begged thee to remain in Ephesus, [when I was] going to Macedonia, that thou mightest enjoin some not to teach other doctrines,

4.text: nor to turn their minds to fables and interminable genealogies, which bring questionings rather than [further] Godâ€™s dispensation, which [is] in faith.

5.text: But the end of what is enjoined is love out of a pure heart and a good conscience and unfeigned faith;

6.text: which [things] some having missed, have turned aside to vain discourse,

7.text: desiring to be law-teachers, not understanding either what they say or concerning what they [so] strenuously affirm.

8.text: Now we know that the law [is] good if any one uses it lawfully,

9.text: knowing this, that law has not its application to a righteous person, but to [the] lawless and insubordinate, to [the] impious and sinful, to [the] unholy and profane, to smiters of fathers and smiters of mothers; to murderers,

10.text: fornicators, sodomites, kidnappers, liars, perjurers; and if any other thing is opposed to sound teaching,

11.text: according to the glad tidings of the glory of the blessed God, with which I have been entrusted.

12.text: [And] I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has given me power, that he has counted me faithful, appointing to ministry him

13.text: who before was a blasphemer and persecutor, and an insolent overbearing [man]: but mercy was shewn me because I did it ignorantly, in unbelief.

14.text: But the grace of our Lord surpassingly over-abounded with faith and love, which [is] in Christ Jesus.

15.text: Faithful [is] the word, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am [the] first.

16.text: But for this reason mercy was shewn me, that in me, [the] first, Jesus Christ might display the whole long-suffering, for a delineation of those about to believe on him to life eternal.

17.text: Now to the King of the ages, [the] incorruptible, invisible, only God, honour and glory to the ages of ages. Amen.

18.text: This charge, [my] child Timotheus, I commit to thee, according to the prophecies as to thee preceding, in order that thou mightest war by them the good warfare,

19.text: maintaining faith and a good conscience; which [last] some, having put away, have made shipwreck as to faith;

20.text: of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have delivered to Satan, that they may be taught by discipline not to blaspheme.
